job_title: FPGA Design Engineer I - Full Time
job_description:
Date Posted: 2025-12-04

Country: United States of America

Location: AZ852: RMS AP Bldg M East Hermans Road Building M02, Tucson, AZ, 85756 USA

Position Role Type: Onsite

U.S. Citizenship and Security Clearance Requirements: Active and transferable U.S. government issued security clearance required prior to start date. Only U.S. citizens are eligible for security clearance.

Security Clearance: DoD Clearance: Secret

At Raytheon, we are dedicated to helping our nation and allies defend freedoms and deter aggression. With more than 100 years of engineering expertise, we strive to meet today's mission challenges. Our team is committed to solving complex problems that foster a safer world.

The FPGA Design Engineer I will develop FPGA designs across various major vendors and device families—including Xilinx, Intel, Microchip, and Lattice. Designs will be implemented using VHDL, addressing applications such as gigabit serial interfaces, Radio Frequency (RF) and Electro-Optical (EO) Digital Signal Processing (DSP), control loops, data links, embedded processing, and processor interfaces. You will collaborate with circuit card designers and systems engineers to gather requirements, select parts, architect the device, perform code development, simulation, and place and route. Your designs will be verified against requirements through both directed testing and constrained random methodologies. Full design support is expected, from requirements definition through integration and testing up to production. Documentation and configuration management of designs will be maintained throughout the entire process.

Qualifications You Must Have:
• Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or related STEM major.
• Experience with digital design and VHDL or Verilog coding.
• Familiarity with Xilinx, Altera, or Microsemi/Microchip FPGAs.
• This position is open to candidates with 12 months or less of relevant professional work experience (excluding internships).

Qualifications We Prefer:
• ABET accreditation preferred, with a desired cumulative GPA of 3.0.
• Familiarity with the Linux environment and commands.
• Expertise in Xilinx, Intel, Microchip, or Lattice devices and tool flows.
• Knowledge of FPGA timing constraints and timing closure.
• Experience in digital signal processing related to FPGA devices.

What We Offer:
• At RTX, our values guide our actions with a commitment to safety, trust, respect, accountability, collaboration, and innovation.
• Relocation eligibility available.

Apply Now!
• Consider the role type definition: Onsite roles require employees to work primarily onsite, as essential for product development.
• Please upload your most recent transcripts along with your resume. Include your cumulative GPA and projected graduation date.
• This role requires a security clearance. DCSA Consolidated Adjudication Services manages the clearance process.

The salary range for this position is $55,000 - $107,000, depending on various factors, including the candidate's experience and responsibilities.

Hired applicants may be eligible for a range of benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and more, varying by business unit.

RTX is an Equal Opportunity Employer, welcoming applications without discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.

job_description:
Job Title: Electrical Design Engineer - Circuit Design

Location: Bohemia, NY on-site

Salary: $80k-$140k /yr depending on experience

Requirements: BSEE or higher, 3+ yrs exp in Electrical Design, Circuit Design involving CPU's, microprosessors, DDR memory, oscilloscopes

Position Overview
We are seeking an experienced Electrical Design Engineer specializing in Circuit Design to join our innovative team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing and implementing electrical circuits for a variety of applications, ensuring they meet specifications and standards.

Key Responsibilities
• Design and develop electrical circuit schematics and layouts.
• Conduct simulations and analysis of circuit designs using industry-standard software.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate circuit designs into larger systems.
• Perform testing and validation of electrical designs to ensure functionality and reliability.
• Troubleshoot and debug circuit issues as they arise during development and production.
• Prepare documentation for designs, including specifications, test plans, and reports.
• Stay up-to-date with industry trends and advancements in electrical design technology.

Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field.
• Proven experience in circuit design and development.
• Strong understanding of electrical engineering principles and practices.
• Proficiency with oscilloscopes and other electrical testing apparatus.
• Familiarity with PCB design and schematic capture tools is a plus.
• Experience in analog and digital electronics design.
• Knowledge of simulation software such as Spice, VHDL, or Verilog is desirable.
• Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and communicate effectively.

Benefits
• Competitive Salary depending on experience
• Annual bonus (prorated in the first year)
• Medical, dental, and vision coverage
• 401(k) plan with company match
• Paid Vacation: 2 weeks to start (prorated in the first year)
• 9/80 summer schedule (discretionary)
• Paid winter break
• Amazing company culture
• Career Growth
• and more!
